item.title: Rita add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, "Why god? Why me?" and the thundering voice of God answered, There's just something about you that pisses me off." -- Stephen King

item.title: Rita add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city." -- George Burns

item.title: Rita add a quote by Max Ehrmann
item.description: "With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams, it is still a beautiful world. Be cheerful. Strive to be happy." -- Max Ehrmann

item.title: Rita add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "The most important thing is to enjoy your life—to be happy—it's all that matters." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Rita add a quote by George Washington Burnap
item.description: "The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for." -- George Washington Burnap

item.title: Rita add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "You have to participate relentlessly in the manifestation of your own blessings." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "A thing of beauty is a joy forever." -- John Keats

item.title: Rita add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Generally speaking, the most miserable people I know are those who are obsessed with themselves; the happiest people I know are those who lose themselves in the service of others...By and large, I have come to see that if we complain about life, it is because we are thinking only of ourselves." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Rita add a quote by Eric Hoffer
item.description: "The hardest arithmetic to master is that which enables us to count our blessings." -- Eric Hoffer
